name: Raingarden (RG), Garden Bed (GB), ), Tree pit (TP), number:
Spec./Site Preparation for Seeding or Planting
8321/8332/Any other site works that will cause rework to landscaping & planting has been completed.
8321/Check for service in the area of this work. Avoid interference or damage to them

8321/ HOLD POINT. Garden bed to be approved by Landscape Architect prior to installation of soil media. Strata Vault installation to align with manufacturers recommendations. Photographs to be provided.
HOLD POINT. Raingarden drainage layers to be approved by Landscape Architect. Photographs to be provided.
Raingardens - hydraulic conductivity to be tested to prove this is in line with raingarden material specification.
Soil to be adequately compacted in 200-300mm layers to ensure no pockets of air within garden bed / tree pit.
HOLD POINT. Garden bed profile to be approved by Landscape Architect and Stormwater Engineer post soil media install. Photographs to be provided.
Should the soil in the garden bed become compromised (by ongoing site works or any other concern) – pH to be tested to prove this is still in line with the soil product specification.
Ensure no standing water at base of tree pits – report to Engineer.
8332/Plant material origin checked on delivery for plant material quality and accepted. All plants to be inspected and approved by Landscaping Architect prior to installation.
All trees to be inspected and approved by Landscape Architect prior to delivery on site. 6 monthly photographs to be provided.
8332/Plant material suitability. Roots eased where root bound. Plants not removed from container too far in advance (avoid drying out).Root balls are moist (not dry).

8332/Spacing and set out in accordance with Landscaping plans and consistent & correct to specification and schedule. Tree species according to drawings. Approved by Landscaping Architect. Specific placement and orientation of trees to be confirmed with Landscape Architect on site – including any required pruning.
8332/Fertiliser/ Crystal Rain Gel incorporated to manufacturers specification
8332/All plants shall be thoroughly watered a few hours prior to planting and again immediately after planting.
8332/Mulch clear of plant stem, Soil not left on top or mixed with bark mulch.
8332/Stakes where required to specification, level and with ties fixed securely.
8333/Landscape Architect to inspect area prior to turf laying. If not available on site then photos to be provided.
Lawn areas to be finished 25mm higher than adjacent hard paving to allow for settlement.
8333/Landscape Architect to inspect area after completion of turf establishment. If not available on site then photos to be provided.
8333/Remove weeds, root material, stones, rubble and any other debris exposed during cultivation.
8333/ Apply a dressing of fertiliser and work into the top 50mm of soil immediately prior to sowing.
Additional areas to be planted/areas missed (mark-up drawings where additional planting may be required)
8332/Surplus plants removed to storage area per specification.
8332/8333 Site cleared of rubbish and surplus materials (containers) removed
(select relevant condition)
values: Sunny (check plants not left bare root in sun),Raining (ensure soil is not saturated which prevents proper planting),Frost (No planting to be carried out until frost thaws out),Overcast (Good Planting condition)

name: The above works have been inspected and on the basis of this check sheet are considered compliant with the drawings, specifications and instructions.
